record.darwin:Remarks: 25 abdominal scutes (17 pre-pelvic); gill rakers 20 on lower limb, anal rays = 37, body depth = ca.27% standard length; keys well to Ilisha in Munroe et al. (1999 FAO Western Central Pacific Guide) but character combination does not exactly fit any species; I. kampeni is closest (esp. in body configuration) but with slightly higher scute and anal ray counts; not mapped as occurring in Gulf of Thailand - Wayne C. Starnes, 2007.
